instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message:
I have 8.5V o/p, Seems like boosting is not occurring, Changed the driver IC, The feedback is proper (Checked the continuity from <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> second pin to A5). 
I have 2.8V <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> . I am ....STUCKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKK.........................

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message:
If is not secret, can we know what board do you have on the desk???

Did you try known good LCD assembly?
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> level?
Try 2-3 times PRAM reset, just in case.,

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message:
I dont have extra lcd for trial, 
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> - Its high If I am not wrong it is 2.1V.
PRAM reset didn't help 
Revealing the secret Board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-22; post diode mode to ground on all them.
Also at both pins of <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.
Post real <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> level.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message:

When I reboot no backlight. Once starts then it keeps working. Does it a software issue or I should resolder it again?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present

You should be sure to get good solders.

There is 16 different brightness control by pressing the F1 and F2 key (Low to High), Only on the 15th position of brightness does it's flickering. I mean brightness doesn't stay stable. It's slightly flickering.

threads.message: Will, it makes sense re soldering the display connecter ? Does <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> control sleep activity?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> puts system to sleep, when lid is closed.
An incorrect level can cause weird issue; if fluctuates close to its threshold voltage.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message: You may disable thunderbolt, if nobody needs it.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message: Can I know the commands for disabling it please?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight , Image is present
threads.message:
If all other functions are good, no need to disable anything.
If no thunderbolt/display port will be used.
Removing <TRANSISTOR>Q3080</TRANSISTOR>, will let thunderbolt "out of game".
